letters.description: Establish a safe and trusting connection with both the client and the horse, emphasizing non-verbal communication and mutual respect.
Facilitate exploration of client's emotions, needs, and challenges through equine-assisted activities and processing.
Guide the client in gaining self-awareness, identifying patterns, and integrating new perspectives through reflection on their experiences with the horse.
Support the client in developing and practicing healthier coping mechanisms and strategies to navigate future challenges, using the horse as a mirror and guide.
Collaborate with the client to create a personalized plan for maintaining progress and integrating equine-assisted insights into their daily life for long-term well-being.
